{"step_by_step_thinking": "Eisenmenger syndrome is a condition in which a congenital heart defect causes pulmonary hypertension and eventual reversal of the shunt into a cyanotic right-to-left shunt. Signs of impending Eisenmenger syndrome include increased flow murmur across tricuspid and pulmonary valve, single S2, and loud P2. Graham steel murmur, on the other hand, is a continuous murmur heard in patients with pulmonary hypertension, but it is not specific to Eisenmenger syndrome. Therefore, the correct answer is D. Graham steel murmur.", "answer_choice": "D"}
